title: Hey Graham
body:
Just wanted to say you really knocked it outta the ballpark with "Where Icathia once stood".

This is the kind of stuff that keeps me interested in lore.

It just oozes great storytelling and you can really feel how much love and attention to detail went into writing that piece.

I wish we would get stories like these more frequently.

So, you know, thanks for that great read, truly inspiring for someone who enjoys writing himself.

replies.body:
Thanks, Malicious!

Yeah, it was a fun piece to write, and folk seem to have been enjoying it.

Up with this sort of thing!

Cheers,

Graham
What other stories did he write? I really enjoyed this one.

IIRC, Graham worked on a bit of Burning Tides and a lot of Shadow and Fortune.

For his non-league work, he's got a few 40k books penned under his name.

If you're interested in his other works, check out [his website.](http://graham-mcneill.com)

Within League, I'm not 100% sure, but from what I recall, if you see the words "limned" or "coruscating" in the text, it's likely him. :P

Beyond that, though, Graham McNeill is a legendary writer who's worked on a huge portion of the Warhammer and Warhammer 40k lore, including a great deal many excellent books. Cap put a link to his official site, and if you're familiar with the 40K franchise, I recommend the stories he's written around the Horus Heresy in particular, namely A Thousand Sons. He's also written several of the codexes, which are excellent reads themselves despite mainly being rulebooks.
riot should gave him many more stories to write.
